fields.description:
We recently upgraded JIRA and attachments are not showing up within the issue.  The file on our server shows that the attachments are present yet the attachments table on the DB does not have any records.

This issue is the same as CONF-31273 which was created under Confluence by mistake.
fields.summary: Cannot see issue attachments after performed an upgrade

fields.description:
A user complained that he could not open any issue yet could navigate through other JIRA pages.

Upon investigation we found out that the user once tried to run a JQL query that was too complex and took ~40 minutes to complete.

He abandoned the query at some point but it got saved in the "Issues > Unsaved filter" menu item.

When the user tried to open any issue after that the query would be sent to JIRA server and the page would not open until the query finished.

We fixed the immediate problem by removing the last unsaved query (entered an empty query in the JQL field) but the potential issue still exists.

Is it possible to a) prevent long running queries from execution (e.g. set a time out on the server side); and b) not to execute any saved/unsaved filters when issues are viewed? Is this configurable or requires JIRA code change?

Thank you
Nikolay Borodachev
fields.summary: Long running JQL query causes browser session to hang when viewing issues

fields.description:
When bulk moving issues, users are able to optionally retain field values when moving their issues.

When performing the same move on a single issue, but not via the 'bulk move' screen, users are not given this option.

In our instance we have 200+ projects that share the same versions across all projects as they roll up into 1 large release. On bulk moves this is fine, but on single moves our users lose their versions, no option to retain.

This is a big oversight which it would seem could be easily remedied as the code already exists for bulk move.
fields.summary: Single issue move does not allow for a 'Retain' checkbox on fields
Feature Issue several sub-tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35428].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,
Let me describe my Atlassian stack administrator story:
Our project has own Atlassian stack (Jira/Confluence/Bamboo/Stash/Fisheye&Cru/Agile/Structure) for almost a year. We had to move from our company's Atlassian infrastructure because it's wasn't so flexible as we wanted and this infra didnt had as much features we have wanted. So we decided to move to our own Atlassian stack and we did a realy great job - we've created fully cross-integrated  stack with a lots of custom features including own macroses and plugins. 
I was the one who has designed and implemented almost all the features we have at the moment. I'm very happy to use such thoughtful&flexible tool  as Jira, Confluence, Bamboo, Stash and I'm excited every time I'm updating our Atlassian stack to a new major version with a lots of cool features.
Starting from Jira 4 and Confluence 4 i'm using installers for Windows  because I found them very useful for many reasons. But.
But there is a thing that causing me a discomfort and sometimes a headache...
As it was told we have a lots of custom modifications that needs to be moved manualy(Proxy ops for tomcat, config modifications, custom plugins, libs and etc) and every time I start the update process using installer I'd like to have a checkbox that will say "Start Jira|Confluence after the update is finished" or "Don't start Jira|Confluence after the update is finished" and Jira or Confluence will not start before I will want it to start. Otherwise Jira(Confluence) usualy starts to do crazy things because of missing fields, spam Exceptions in logs,two times even database was corrupted and we had to rollback. Of Course I have the workaround but it's looks like a dirty-hack. I think my life (and not only mine;) ) will be much happier if your will add the mentioned checkbox to your installer.

Hope for your understanding!

P.S. Many thanks to Atlassian team! You do outstanding things!
fields.summary: Add "Don't start Jira after the update" checkbox to Jira/Confluence installer for Windows
JIRA should not attach the winmail.dat file which is generated by certain microsoft email clients

fields.description:
When an user (with timezone GMT+4) search data from Issue Navigator, the created date will change back to less one day in Basic Search.

h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Setup a JIRA instance in GMT+2 timezone (Europe/Helsinki).
# User (with timezone GMT+4) access to the Issue Navigator.
# Run the following JQL query:
{noformat}
project = PA AND created >= 2013-06-18 AND created <= 2013-10-22 ORDER BY updated DESC
{noformat}
(i) Switch to Basic Search
# Query results are expected and filter looks right now.
# If you click any sort, i.e. sort by "Updated" date, filter immediately changes to *Created Date: 17/JUN/13 - 21/OCT/13*. For example:
!basic.png|thumbnail!
# Switch back to Advanced Search:
!advance.png|thumbnail!

h4.Finding:
* The created date is correct when switch back to Advanced Search.
* The searching based on the created date is correct.
fields.summary: Click any sort will change to less one day after switch back to Basic Search
nevermind

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35422].
  {panel}

Currently there is no option to make the Work Description field in {{View Issue Screen >> More >> Log Work}} a required field. Having one would be nice.

h3. Workaround
The best options seem to be the following plugins:
* [JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions].
* [Tempo Timesheets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/is.origo.jira.tempo-plugin].

Please note they both are third party plugins and they are not supported by Atlassian. Please contact the plugin vendors if you need more information on them.
fields.summary: Create an option to make Work Description a required field

fields.description:
Repro steps
# Log in as a JIRA admin.
# Click the Gear, then System (under Administration)
# Choose a CSV import
# Browse to the attached Jira_Import.csv
# Set CSV Delimiter to tab \t
# Click next
# Select any active JIRA project, hit next
# Map fields: (1) Issue Key to Issue Key (2) Summary to Summary
# Click next.

EXPECTED:
Error page with a complaint about the contents of the fields in CSV. The following should be displayed on the screen.
bq. org.supercsv.exception.SuperCsvException: unexpected end of file while reading quoted column beginning on line 688 and ending on line 699

ACTUAL:
Browser reports a "Content Encoding Error" (Firefox). (screen shot attached in jira1.png). IE and Chrome also display no error specifics. Debugging in Fiddler is necessary to find the actual cause of the error.

Full JIRA HTTP response from Fiddler is attached in 4_Response.txt

NOTE: I figured out how to fix the input file, there are smart quotes and other bad characters in it. The request is that I don't have to debug in Fiddler to figure this out :) Please change JIRA to display the HTML in the HTTP 500 response.
fields.summary: CSV Import - bad file format causes browser issue

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary
When shutting down Jira using it's built-in scripts ('stop-jira.sh', 'shutdown.sh' or 'catalina.sh stop'), the same memory allocation settings used by Jira will be read by the auxiliary Java process (org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap) spun up to execute shutdown tasks.

If the lower boundary is set too high - sometimes equals to the upper boundary as recommended by Atlassian Support - it may not be able to execute as it will require effectively double the allocated memory available on the OS.

h3. Expected Behavior
Use a lower, default memory allocation setup for the shutdown process separate to the one used by Jira's main Java process.

h3. Actual Behavior
The shutdown process fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the memory settings for Jira so that the lower boundary is significantly more than half the available memory on the OS;
# Start Jira and shut it down subsequently;

Observe that the shutdown process will fail and throw an error similar to the following:

{noformat:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
Java HotSpot(TM\) 64-Bit Server VM warning: INFO: os::commit_memory(0x0000000680000000, 5368709120, 0\) failed; error='Cannot allocate memory' \(errno=12\)
\#
\# There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue.
\# Native memory allocation \(mmap\) failed to map 5368709120 bytes for committing reserved memory.
\# An error report file with more information is saved as:
\# /opt/jira/bin/hs_err_pid25290.log
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
# Access Jira's *<Jira_Installation>/bin/setenv.sh* file.
 # Locate, then *remove the following lines*:
{code:java}
JAVA_OPTS="-Xms${JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY} -Xmx${JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY} ${JVM_CODE_CACHE_ARGS} ${JAVA_OPTS} ${JVM_REQUIRED_ARGS} ${DISABLE_NOTIFICATIONS} ${JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS} ${JVM_EXTRA_ARGS} ${JIRA_HOME_MINUSD} ${START_JIRA_JAVA_OPTS}"

export JAVA_OPTS
{code}
 # *Add the following lines to the exact place* from where we removed the old ones.
{code}
#--------------------------- Workaround for JRASERVER-35398 --------------------------------------------------------

# Taking into account Order of JAVA_OPTS and CATALINA_OPTS in startup:
#
# We set JVM XMX 2 times:
#  - generic, for Tomcat only through JAVA_OPTS
#  - specific for Jira, one more time through CATALINA_OPTS
#
# 512MB should be enough for Tomcat stop process

TOMCAT_JVM_OPTS="-Xms512m -Xmx512m"

JAVA_OPTS="${JAVA_OPTS} ${TOMCAT_JVM_OPTS} ${JVM_REQUIRED_ARGS} ${DISABLE_NOTIFICATIONS} ${JVM_EXTRA_ARGS} ${JIRA_HOME_MINUSD} ${START_JIRA_JAVA_OPTS} ${JVM_CODE_CACHE_ARGS} ${JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS}"

export JAVA_OPTS

JVM_OPTS_CATALINA="-Xms${JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY} -Xmx${JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY}" 

CATALINA_OPTS="${JVM_OPTS_CATALINA} ${CATALINA_OPTS}"

export CATALINA_OPTS  
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{code}
 # Save the changes.
 # Restart Jira.
 # Repeat the process on the other nodes (if any).
fields.summary: Shutting down Jira with built-in scripts may fail due to memory exhaustion

fields.description:
If a custom field is marked as required on a project associated with an Issue Collector, without updating the Issue Collector form itself, submitting a ticket on the collector will generate an 'oops' error.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test project, *TEST*
# Create a basic issue collector for *TEST* project
# Remove all additional fields from collector form (leaving only Summary, Name, Email) and save collector
# Embed the html or javascript collector code into the JIRA announcement banner or whatever test environment of choice 
# Test creating feedback to confirm it works
# Create a new custom field (single text field), *CustomField1* and configure for _Global projects_, and add to all screens
# Navigate to '_Default Field Configuration_' and mark *CustomField1* as *required*
# Trigger a new feedback on issue collector (noting that the field does not show on screen)

h4. Expected Results
Ticket is created, or 'required missing field' error should be generated 

h4. Actual Results
'Oops' error is generated on screen, and a similar 'Detected missing fields in collector' x is thrown in logs:
{noformat}
2013-10-18 15:11:41,024 http-bio-9610-exec-8 ERROR admin 911x4581x1 1io5v0c 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/collectors/1.0/template/custom/ded93db8 [collector.plugin.rest.TemplateResource] Detected missing fields in collector 'Test Project Collector' (id: ded93db8, project: TEST): [customfield_10200]
{noformat}


h4. Workaround
# Navigate to edit the Issue Collector Form, and scroll to the bottom
# Confirm that *required* field is automatically added to the form
# Click update
fields.summary: Issue Collector Generating an Oops Error After Adding a Required Field

fields.description:
Plugins like GreenHopper and Service Desk which "do stuff" on JIRA start-up/plugin enabled event are suffering from a race condition with JIRA's I18n system. The plugin can (rightfully) request the translation of a key *before* it's i18n plugin modules have been registered with JIRA. This causes the translation to be returned as the raw key instead of the message.

This is affecting customers today.

h3. Workaround

For GreenHopper, please see the workaround steps as detailed in GHS-9193.
fields.summary: Race condition occurs between JIRA and plugins with i18n translation - REGRESSION
JIRA Shortcuts and Service names should remain on upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35376].
  {panel}

I just spent 2 days changing descriptions on a bunch of fields in our JIRA environment which would have only taken about an hour if the Descriptions in the Field Configurations had the ability to inherit the descriptions from the parent field.  This is currently very misleading when it allows you to create a description on the field itself, but once the field is created, any changes to the description need to be done in each Field Configuration.

I would suggest supplying a checkbox in the Edit view for the field in the Field Configuration which will allow you to inherit the description from the parent field.  Then, when viewing the field information on the global level, have a little dropdown of sorts, like you do for Field Configurations Shared by projects, but have it list all the Field Configurations which do NOT inherit the description from the parent field.

This will make it extremely easy to manage these descriptions in the future for massive changes.

Example of the massive change that we had to do:  We have a Engineering specific Help document on our SharePoint environment, and the location of the document changed.  So i had to go through and change every single instance that used that link to the new URL.  It took an extremely long time to do.
fields.summary: Provide a method to inherit description in Field Configuration from parent field

I've created a custom field Severity, with two contexts. Project FOO has options as below:
||Option||Sequence||
|Critical|0|
|Major|1|
|Minor|2|
Project BAR has options as below:
||Option||Sequence||
|None|0|
|Critical|1|
|Major|2|
|Minor|3|
|N/A|4|

When sorting these in the Issue Navigator, Major in project FOO is considered to be equivalent to Critical in BAR, which looks like an inconsistent result to our users. Modern browsers have added a very useful pinned tab functionality:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/pinned-tabs-keep-favorite-websites-open#w_how-are-pinned-tabs-different-than-normal-tabs

One feature of pinned tabs is tab highlighting. When the title of the pinned tab changes, the tab is highlighted with a glow effect.

This is very useful for quickly viewing notifications from many different websites.

If this feature were implemented I could completely disable my JIRA email notifications. This is a big win for cutting down on the users everyday email deluge.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35369].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When exporting JIRA issues to Excel, it exports files in XLS files. The same occurs for exports to Word, which generates files in DOC format. These files have multiple disadvantages when compared to the new file types introduced by Microsoft in 2007 (DOCX, XLSX and PPTX). That's because those new file formats are XML-based, which allows for much better compression, resulting in considerably smaller files.

Also, Excel's new file format (XLSX) adds an extra layer of security by blocking the usage of Macros, which requires the file to be saved as XLSM. XLS files allows for any Macro to be included and is being blocked by multiple System Administrators, especially in companies with higher standards for security.

h3. Example
Exporting around 4900 issues to Excel from JIRA currently generates a file with an approximate size of 7.5 MB. If we convert that file to XLSX once it has been opened in Excel 2007 or later, the file size drops to less than 10% of the original file's size.

h3. Workaround
The [Better Excel Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.midori.jira.plugin.betterexcel], developed by Midori, adds additional features for exporting issues to Excel in JIRA, including the ability to export directly to XLSX.

(i) _Please note third-party add-ons, such as "Better Excel Plugin", *are not* supported by Atlassian. Therefore, support and maintenance is purely responsibility of the add-on's vendor._
fields.summary: JIRA Exports files in old format / standards resulting in large file sizes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35366].
  {panel}

In our [Connecting JIRA to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+Oracle] documentation, the following is stated:
bq. Note, the {{<database-type/>}} element must specify your type of database, e.g. {{oracle11g}}. If you forget to do this and you start JIRA, your database tables may be created incorrectly.
{quote}
h4. Sample dbconfig.xml file

For more information about the child elements of <jdbc-datasource/> beginning with pool in the dbconfig.xml file above, see [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Tuning+Database+Connections].
{code:XML| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
 
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle11g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@dbserver:1521:ORCL</url>
    <driver-class>oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</driver-class>
    <username>jiradbuser</username>
    <password>password</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
 
    <validation-query>select 1 from dual</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
   
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}
{quote}

However, JIRA does not have a oracle11g definition, and configuring JIRA to use that cause JIRA to fail to start correctly. Therefore, we need to fix this information in our documentation to avoid further problems for our customers.
fields.summary: Update our Connecting JIRA to Oracle documentation to use 'oracle10g' instead of 'oracle11g'

This is related to JDEV-25501. 

Try https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=TST&issuetypeName=Bug&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
notice that assignee field is marked as required.

From testing we concluded that
- the returned value ignores the "allow unassigned issues" flag
- most likely JAC has corrupted data

[~mquail] and [~mlassau] have more technical info.
fields.summary: rest metadata call on JAC wrongly claims that assignee field is a required field
Please provide link to release notes in release announcement
I need a way to put text/titles on my wallboard to explain what my gadgets are displaying
Background re-indexing can cause excesive memory consumption leading to the instance becoming unresponsive.
Allow "mentioned user" to be added to permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35354].
  {panel}

The documentation found here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server

Specifically this paragraph:

3.4 Migrate your existing JIRA configurations over to your new JIRA installation
If you have modified properties in configuration files of your existing JIRA installation, make the same modifications in your new JIRA installation. However, because the properties in the configuration files may have changed between versions, you cannot simply copy the configuration files from your existing installation and replace the equivalent files in the new installation.

Needs to be improved to specify which configuration files are relevant.
fields.summary: Documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server

fields.description: We found a duplicate date on 19th October. see attached
fields.summary: Calendar Error
Able to update priority of sub-task from drop down menu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35351].
  {panel}

When a user searches for issues in a specific project (or a list or projects) and he does not have the Browse Project permission for the project, he gets the following message

*The value '10001' does not exist for the field 'project'*
Where '10001' is the project ID or name used in the JQL.

This message could be different for projects that do exist but the user simply does not have permission to browse it, like the following.
*You do not have permission to browse the project '10001'* 

This would help a lot of customers that get this message and may believe the project has been deleted somehow.
fields.summary: Change message displayed in Issue Navigator for projects without browse permission

fields.description:
When working with inactive workflows, after creating new workflow and adding to the canvas, any workflow name change causes the canvas to be completely disorientated. 
Transition lines change to straight from curved/angled and statuses reposition themselves out of sync. 
Since cannot change name on active workflows, not so much an issue however have not tested when changing description. 
Draft workflow do have this issue which was existing in earlier JIRA versions - thought it was resolved but apparently not - we're on version 6.08.

Please fix as it's a time waster when creating complex workflows OR remove the ability to edit name & description altogether.
fields.summary: Workflow canvas disorientates when saving name
Update 'Connecting JIRA to MySQL' article

fields.description:
I make extensive use of Jira's Webhooks and they work really nice, except on Time Estimate change. For some reason this event doesn't trigger a webhook and thus doesn't allow me to update my other apps.

Is this a bug or is something am I missing here?

Thanks
fields.summary: Time Estimate change won't trigger Webhook

fields.description:
It appears that the un-installation of a plugin under certain circumstances seems to have caused an unstable state in JIRA, also resulting in JIRA displaying the following error within the interface when trying to use JIRA:
{quote}
"Method invoked on module descriptor after it was destroyed. This is only legal for some methods on AbstractModuleDescriptor.
Could not find what you were looking for. Maybe you should raise an issue."
{quote}

The error doesn't go away until a restart is actually performed.

So far, the problem has been observed in support cases after uninstall of:
* Gantt Chart Plugin
* Vertigo SLA plugin (archived - now incorporated into Service Desk)
Perhaps it may happen with any random plugin however, as there was no striking pattern observed between this two plugins.

_Also, because this is very hard to reproduce we may need developers to verify if the issue is now obsolete or can still potentially occur in more current versions of JIRA._

fields.summary: IllegalStateException thrown after uninstalling plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35340].
  {panel}

The "Save" Option is not provided when user modify their JQL for existing filter in Advanced Search due to a search has to be performed prior to the save.

There's a difference between Simply search and Advance Search. For simple search, the search result would be refresh once you chose some options. However in Advanced Search, the save option only available right after a search on modified JQL in existing filter was performed by the user.

An information should be given under the *To update the search criteria of one of your existing filters:* section of the following documentation:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Filters#UsingFilters-updating_filter_detailsUpdatingafilter
fields.summary: Add an information to Update filter documentation

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce:
# Go to Advanced Search
# Type the preferred JQL(eg. issuetype = Bug)
# Save the JQL as new filter (Don't search the query before you save the filter)

h5. Expected Result:
JQL saved as new filter and the JQL remain in the text box 

h5. Actual Result:
JQL saved but the JQL are lost. An empty JQL was saved in the filter.

!actual.png|thumbnail!

h5. Note:
If a search was performed (i.e. you click on the search icon) prior to saving the new filter, the JQL will be saved.
fields.summary: JQL lost after a new filter is saved in Advanced Search

fields.description:
Long text fails to expand when "Read More" link is clicked in "Activity" tab of "Activity" heading.

When a long text is entered in description of any task/bug then in Activity tab it gets wrapped up. A "Read More" link is available in new line below the activity text and above the time-stamp. On clicking the "Read More" link, the wrapped text should expand so that the whole text should be readable. But this functionality seems to be broken (as the text fails to expand).
Steps To Reproduce:
1. Click on "Activity" tab (under Activity heading).
2. Notice that the text "Description" field is wrapped and "Read More" link is also available.
3. Click on "Read More" Link
4. Observe that the wrapped text fails to expend.


Note: As the whole text can be see above (in description field) or by simply scrolling up the page (as per JRA-29750 this is intended feature). So "Read More" link should not be present if it is not used to expend the text. 

Please see the attached screen shot for more clarification.
fields.summary: Long text fails to expand when "Read More" link is clicked in "Activity" tab of "Activity" heading.

fields.description:
If you edit a draft workflow and remove a transition screen, the Jira GUI shows "Screen : none", but the downloadable XML keeps in place the id of the previously selected screen, even after a restart of Jira.

At the very least, it's very confusing when editing a large workflow and using the XML to check you didn't forgot some needed changes.

*Steps to reproduce :*
- start a brand new jira with atlas-create-jira-plugin then atlas-run
- create a new workflow : open -> in progress -> closed, and attach the default screen on each transition
- attach this workflow to a project
- edit the workflow to remove the default screen on one of the transitions, then publish the draft
- download the XML of the workflow : you'll still see the screen id present (see screenshot attached)
fields.summary: Downloadable XML workflow incorrect after removing a transition view
Remember cursor position on text fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35327].
  {panel}

I downloaded the JIRA 6.1 trial version and came across the Issue Collector concept.
This seemed like a really neat idea to help integrate JIRA creation with any website.
I created an Issue Collector with a custom form containing my custom fields along with some native fields for hte users to fill in, and copied the provided HTML to a Script Editor web part on a page in SharePoint.

This allowed me to request the creation of a JIRA, but the form layout was scrambled, so whilst all of the fields did exist it was hard to see them and enter values - see attached screen shots.
 '_1' shows the Summary and Description fields - there is no scroll bar, the field names are seen under the field value boxes.
 '_2' shows what happens when I manage eventually to scroll down to the other fields - again the field names are under the field value boxes
'_3' shows another attempt to create an issue and scroll down when it wouldn't let me go past the Environment field, seen at the top above the Summary and Description fields
'_4' shows what I see when I finally give up and submit the issue!

The HTML that I inserted into the Script Editor web part is as follows:

<script type="text/javascript" src="http://localhost:8080/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_GBio9p4o-1988229788/6144/4/1.4.0-m6/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector.js?collectorId=d881c35c"></script>

Please let me know if you need any more information from me.

When I tried using the standard Issue Collector Feedback form, this worked perfectly using the same method of adding it to the SharePoint page
fields.summary: Issue Collector custom form scrambled
